intro: Brownea angustiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved brownea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red, with a distinctive spurred structure. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
